intro: Scabiosa media, commonly known as the common scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clustered, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and meadows. Scabiosa media is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
